title: 16-year-old seriously hurt in Springfield shooting
content:
Springfield police are investigating a shooting that left a 16-year-old boy seriously injured Thursday afternoon.
Officers were sent to the 200 block of 12th Street between Adams and Monroe streets about 12:10 p.m.
The teen suffered apparent gunshot wounds to his neck, back, leg and foot. He was conscious and alert when officers arrived, but his injuries are considered life-threatening, police said. The last update police received was that the teen was in surgery at HSHS St. John's Hospital.
The assailants were described as two black teenagers. One was wearing a black or dark-colored hoodie, and the other was wearing what appeared to be an orange hoodie. Witnesses said the teens fired six shots and then ran east down an alley.
After the shooting, officers could be seen searching a vacant lot across the street from where the victim was found. They also searched the alley the two assailants used to flee the scene.
Anyone with information for police can submit tips anonymously by calling Crime Stoppers at 788-8427 or online at www.cashfortips.us. Tips can also be sent by text. Type TIP672 plus a message and send to CRIMES. Informants are eligible for cash rewards of up to $1,000.
